meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a simplex.
meanings.sent1: The simplicial shape had straight edges and flat sides.
meanings.sent2: The mathematician studied the simplicial structure of the geometric figure.
meanings.sent3: The simplicial puzzle was so easy, even a child could solve it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were organized in a simplicial manner, each idea neatly connected to the next.
meanings.sent5: The simplicial design of the building made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to simplices.
meanings.sent1: The simplicial elements of the set were easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a beautiful painting using simplicial shapes.
meanings.sent3: The simplicial cake was a hit at the party, with each slice perfectly shaped.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a simplicial composition, each word carefully chosen and placed.
meanings.sent5: The simplicial pattern on the fabric gave it a modern and clean look.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a simplicial complex.
meanings.sent1: The simplicial complex was a fascinating mathematical structure.
meanings.sent2: The researcher explored the properties of the simplicial complex.
meanings.sent3: The simplicial complex of events led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a simplicial complex, processing information in layers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted a colorful and intricate simplicial complex.
